intro: Omphalodes ripleyana, commonly known as the Ripleys' omphalodes, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its small, clustered flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is noted for its ornamental value in gardens. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil conditions.
